lead_paragraph: The popular software gives users power to lighten their skin and reshape their faces — a definition of beauty that may not work in other places.

byline.contributor: Amie Tsang reported from Hong Kong, and Emily Feng from Beijing.
byline.original: By AMIE TSANG and EMILY FENG

headline.main: China’s Meitu, an Aspirational Beauty App, Goes Public

snippet: The popular software gives users power to lighten their skin and reshape their faces — a definition of beauty that may not work in other places....
abstract: Idea that beauty is path to success in Chinese culture has scores of women there using Meitu photo editing app to create idealized versions of themselves to share with others and use as aspirational model; Chinese-based company has 446 million users and has plans to expand but some wonder if Meitu's idea of beauty will be embraced by other markets.
